results.name: Sum_{k = 1..n-1 such that n == k mod 2^k} 2^(k-1).
comment: Is there a simpler closed form?
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
David Applegate, Benoit Cloitre, Philippe Deléham and N. J. A. Sloane, Sloping binary numbers: a new sequence related to the binary numbers [pdf, ps].
David Applegate, Benoit Cloitre, Philippe Deléham and N. J. A. Sloane, Sloping binary numbers: a new sequence related to the binary numbers, J. Integer Seq. 8 (2005), no. 3, Article 05.3.6, 15 pp.
maple: f:=proc(n) local t1,k; t1:=0; for k from 1 to n-1 do if n mod 2^k = k then t1:=t1+2^(k-1); fi; od: t1; end;
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k = 1, n-1, if ((n % 2^k) == k, 2^(k-1))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 06 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 22 2005
